sen.j: 真土事件（しんどじけん）は1878年（明治11年）、神奈川県大住郡真土村（現平塚市）に起こった農民暴動。
sen.e: The Shindo incident is a revolt by peasants that took place in Shindo Village (present-day Hiratsuka City), Osumi County, Kanagawa Prefecture in 1878.
The Shindo incident is a peasants' revolt that took place in Shindo Village (present-day Hiratsuka City), Osumi County, Kanagawa Prefecture in 1878.
sen.cmt: 若干表現を変えました。
sen.e: The Shindo incident is a peasants' revolt that took place in Shindo Village (present-day Hiratsuka City), Osumi County, Kanagawa Prefecture in 1878.

sen.j: 「真土騒動」「松木騒動」とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called 'The Shindo Revolt' or 'The Matsuki Revolt.'
It is also known as 'the Shindo Revolt' or 'the Matsuki Revolt.'
sen.cmt: 若干表現を変えました。
sen.e: It is also known as 'the Shindo Revolt' or 'the Matsuki Revolt.'

sen.j: 村の戸長は勝手に村人の質地を自分の名義に変えてしまい裁判となる。
sen.e: In the village, an officer in charge of the family register arbitrarily changed villagers' land to his possession, and was sued.
The officer who was in charge of administrative affairs of this village arbitrarily transferred villagers' pawned lands into his possession, and was sued.
sen.cmt: 戸長「地方行政事務を司る役人」、質地の説明を補いました。
sen.e: The officer who was in charge of administrative affairs of this village arbitrarily transferred villagers' pawned lands into his possession, and was sued.

sen.j: 一審では村人が勝訴したが、二審では敗訴。
sen.e: The villagers won the first trial, but lost the second.
The villagers won the first trial, but lost the second.
The villagers won the first trial, but lost the second.

sen.j: 再審の費用の無い村人は暴動を起こし、戸長一家を殺害した。
sen.e: The villagers had no money to make an appeal to higher court, so they provoked a revolt and murdered him and his family.
The villagers had no money to make an appeal to a higher court, so they provoked a revolt and murdered the officer and his family.
The villagers had no money to make an appeal to a higher court, so they provoked a revolt and murdered the officer and his family.

sen.j: また泉鏡花はこの事件を素材とした『冠弥左衛門』を書いて文壇にテビューした。
sen.e: Kyoka IZUMI wrote a novel called "Kanmuri Yazaemon" on the theme of this incident and started his career as a novelist.
Kyoka IZUMI wrote a novel titled "Kanmuri Yazaemon" on the theme of this incident and started his career as a novelist.
Kyoka IZUMI wrote a novel titled "Kanmuri Yazaemon" on the theme of this incident and started his career as a novelist.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）11月、冠弥右衛門ら六五名は区長兼戸長職にあった松木長右衛門に土地の請け戻しを横浜裁判所に訴え、勝訴。
sen.e: In November 1876, 65 peasants including Yaemon KANMURI made a lawsuit against Choemon MATSUKI, the ward mayor and officer in charge of the family register, for the redemption of the land to the Yokohama Court and won the case.

In November 1876, 65 peasants including Yaemon KANMURI filed a lawsuit against Choemon MATSUKI, the ward mayor and kocho (the officer in charge of administrative affairs), for the redemption of the lands to the Yokohama Court and won the case.

In November 1876, 65 peasants including Yaemon KANMURI filed a lawsuit against Choemon MATSUKI, the ward mayor and kocho (the officer in charge of administrative affairs), for the redemption of the lands to the Yokohama Court and won the case.

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）9月、松木は上等裁判所に控訴。
sen.e: In September 1878, Matsuki appealed to the High Court.
In September 1878, Matsuki appealed to the High Court.
In September 1878, Matsuki appealed to the High Court.

sen.j: 二審では冠弥右衛門らは敗訴し、訴訟費用や延納小作料の厳しい請求を受けた。
sen.e: Yaemon KANMURI and others lost the case at the second court, and faced a strict levy of legal costs and delayed farm rent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yaemon KANMURI and others lost the case at the second court and faced a strict levy of legal costs and arrears of farm rent.
Yaemon KANMURI and others lost the case at the second court and faced a strict levy of legal costs and arrears of farm rent.

sen.j: 大審院への控訴費用がないどころか、凍餓の危機を迎える。
sen.e: They were genuinely distressed, and of course they had no money to make an appeal to the Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Needless to say they have no money to make an appeal to the Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan); further, they were forced to face starvation.
Needless to say they have no money to make an appeal to the Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan); further, they were forced to face starvation.

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）10月26日深夜、冠弥右衛門以下26名の村民が松木長右衛門の家を焼打にし、7名殺害、4名に傷を負わせた。
sen.e: Late at night on October 26, 1878, 26 villagers led by Yaemon KANMURI set fire to the house of Choemon MATSUKI, and murdered seven people and injured four people.
Late at night on October 26, 1878, 26 villagers led by Yaemon KANMURI set fire to the house of Choemon MATSUKI, and murdered seven people and injured four people.
Late at night on October 26, 1878, 26 villagers led by Yaemon KANMURI set fire to the house of Choemon MATSUKI, and murdered seven people and injured four people.

tit.e: Influence and sequel of the incident
Influence and sequel of the incident
Influence and sequel of the incident

sen.j: 事件発生から一ヶ月の間に約1,800名による冠らの助命嘆願書が県庁に寄せられた。
sen.e: In one month after the incident, about 1,800 people sent documents of plea for sparing lives of Kanmuri and others to the Prefectural Government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Within one month after the incident, about 1,800 people sent a petition for sparing lives of Kanmuri and others to the prefectural government.
Within one month after the incident, about 1,800 people sent a petition for sparing lives of Kanmuri and others to the prefectural government.

sen.j: 翌年までに15,000名の署名が集められた。
sen.e: Signatures by 15,000 people were collected by the next year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Signatures of 15,000 people had been collected by the next year.
sen.cmt: 時制等文法を直しました。
sen.e: Signatures of 15,000 people had been collected by the next year.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）5月、建長寺住職の松本等隣は、円覚寺住職の今北洪川、清浄光寺（藤沢・遊行寺）住職の他阿尊敬とともに神奈川県令野村靖宛に減刑の「嘆願書」を提出。
sen.e: In May 1879, Torin MATSUMOTO, the chief priest of Kencho-ji Temple, submitted a petition for mitigation to Yasushi NOMURA, the Governor of Kanagawa Prefecture, together with Kozen IMAKITA, the chief priest of Engaku-ji Temple and Sonkei TAA, the chief priest of Shojoko-ji Temple (also known as Yugyo-ji Temple in Fujisawa).
sen.cmt: 「田阿尊敬」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: In May 1879, Torin MATSUMOTO, the chief priest of Kencho-ji Temple, submitted a petition for mitigation of a penalty to Yasushi NOMURA, the Governor of Kanagawa Prefecture, together with Kozen IMAKITA, the chief priest of Engaku-ji Temple, and Sonkei TAA, the chief priest of Shojoko-ji Temple (also known as Yugyo-ji Temple in Fujisawa).
sen.cmt: 語を補いました。「田阿尊敬」正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: In May 1879, Torin MATSUMOTO, the chief priest of Kencho-ji Temple, submitted a petition for mitigation of a penalty to Yasushi NOMURA, the Governor of Kanagawa Prefecture, together with Kozen IMAKITA, the chief priest of Engaku-ji Temple, and Sonkei TAA, the chief priest of Shojoko-ji Temple (also known as Yugyo-ji Temple in Fujisawa).

sen.j: 1880年（明治13年）、武田交来『冠松真土夜嵐』刊。
sen.e: In 1880, Korai TAKEDA published "Kamuri no Matsu Mado no Yoarashi."
In 1880, Korai TAKEDA published "Kamuri no Matsu Mado no Yoarashi."
In 1880, Korai TAKEDA published "Kamuri no Matsu Mado no Yoarashi."

sen.j: 1881年（明治14年）6月、初代柳亭燕枝（談洲楼燕枝 (初代)）（仮名垣魯文の弟子のあら垣痴文）は横浜市住吉町港座で『深山の松木間月影』を上演。
sen.e: In June 1881, Enshi RYUTEI (the first; Enshi DANSHURO [the first]) (also known as Chibun ARAGAKI, a disciple of Robun KANAGAKI) performed "Miyama no Matsukima Tsukikage" at Minato-za Theater in Sumiyoshi-cho, Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 「あら垣痴文」「深山の松木間月影」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: In June 1881, Enshi RYUTEI (the first; Enshi DANSHURO [the first]) (also known as Chibun ARAGAKI, a disciple of Robun KANAGAKI) performed "Miyama no Matsukima Tsukikage" at Minato-za Theater in Sumiyoshi-cho, Yokohama City.

In June 1881, Enshi RYUTEI (the first; Enshi DANSHURO [the first]) (also known as Chibun ARAGAKI, a disciple of Robun KANAGAKI) performed "Miyama no Matsukima Tsukikage" at Minato-za Theater in Sumiyoshi-cho, Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 引用符を半角にしました。

sen.j: 主演は中村時蔵、板東しうか、嵐芳五郎ら。
sen.e: The main actors were Tokizo NAKAMURA, Shiuka BANDO, Yoshigoro ARASHI and others.
The main actors were Tokizo NAKAMURA, Shiuka BANDO, Yoshigoro ARASHI and others.
The main actors were Tokizo NAKAMURA, Shiuka BANDO, Yoshigoro ARASHI and others.

sen.j: 未曾有の大入りで、特に時蔵の弥右衛門が好評であったという。
sen.e: The theater was packed to capacity, and particularly Yaemon performed by Tokizo gained much popularity.
The theater was packed to capacity, and particularly Yaemon performed by Tokizo gained much popularity.
The theater was packed to capacity, and particularly Yaemon performed by Tokizo gained much popularity.

sen.j: 1881年（明治14年）7月、横浜市羽衣町下田座（さの座）にて『真土の松庭木植換』上演。
sen.e: In July 1881, "Shindo no Matsuniwaki Uekae" was performed at Shimoda-za Theater (also known as Sano-za Theater) in Hagoromo-cho, Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 「真土の松庭木植換」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: In July 1881, "Shindo no Matsuniwaki Uekae" was performed at Shimoda-za Theater (also known as Sano-za Theater) in Hagoromo-cho, Yokohama City.
In July 1881, "Shindo no Matsuniwaki Uekae" was performed at Shimoda-za Theater (also known as Sano-za Theater) in Hagoromo-cho, Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 引用符を半角にしました。

sen.j: 出演は板東彦十郎、中村伝五郎、市川寿美之丞ら。
sen.e: Performing actors were Hikojuro BANDO, Dengoro NAKAMURA, Suminojo ICHIKAWA and others.
Performing actors were Hikojuro BANDO, Dengoro NAKAMURA, Suminojo ICHIKAWA and others.
Performing actors were Hikojuro BANDO, Dengoro NAKAMURA, Suminojo ICHIKAWA and others.

sen.j: 未曾有の大入りであったという。
sen.e: The theater was packed to capacity.
The theater was packed to capacity.
The theater was packed to capacity.

sen.j: 1880年説もある。
sen.e: Some say it was performed in 1880.
Some say it was performed in 1880.
Some say it was performed in 1880.

sen.j: 1882年（明治15年）2月15日、冠弥右衛門、養親を理由として、収贖（しゅうしょく・罰金での代替）による出獄を許可される。
sen.e: On February 15, 1882, Yaemon KANMURI was discharged from prison on condition that he carry out shushoku (substitute by forfeit), because he had a relative to look after.
On February 15, 1882, Yaemon KANMURI was discharged from prison on condition that he would carry out shushoku (substitute by a forfeit), because he had a relative to look after.
On February 15, 1882, Yaemon KANMURI was discharged from prison on condition that he would carry out shushoku (substitute by a forfeit), because he had a relative to look after.

sen.j: 1883年（明治16年）4月29日、大住郡堀山下村61名の総代として、南条繁次郎以下十数名が、同村山口太平宅に押し寄せて恐迫。
sen.e: On April 29, 1883, as the representatives of 61 villagers in Horiyamashita Village, Osumi County, more than ten people led by Shigejiro NANJO intruded on the house of Tahei YAMAGUCHI in the same village and threatened him.
sen.cmt: 「堀山下村」「南条繁次郎」「山口太平」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: On April 29, 1883, as the representatives of 61 villagers in Horiyamashita Village, Osumi County, more than ten people led by Shigejiro NANJO intruded on the house of Tahei YAMAGUCHI in the same village and threatened him.

On April 29, 1883, as the representatives of 61 villagers in Horiyamashita Village, Osumi County, more than ten people led by Shigejiro NANJO intruded on the house of Tahei YAMAGUCHI in the same village and threatened him.

sen.j: 1883年（明治16年）10月14日、同郡小易村農民40余名が、同村字丹沢山に集結して竹槍などを持ち出して、同村大森幾太郎、大津定右衛門、鈴木三右衛門らを襲おうと計画。
sen.e: On October 14, 1883, more than 40 peasants in Koyasu Village, Osumi County gathered at a place called Tanzawayama in that village and attempted to attack Kitaro OMORI, Sadaemon OTSU, Sanemon SUZUKI and others with bamboo spears.
sen.cmt: 「大森幾多郎」「大津定右衛門」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: On October 14, 1883, more than 40 peasants in Koyasu Village, Osumi County gathered at a place called Tanzawayama in that village and attempted to attack Kitaro OMORI, Sadaemon OTSU, Sanemon SUZUKI and others with bamboo spears.

On October 14, 1883, more than 40 peasants in Koyasu Village, Osumi County gathered at a place called Tanzawayama in that village and attempted to attack Kitaro OMORI, Sadaemon OTSU, Sanemon SUZUKI and others with bamboo spears.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）3月29日夜、同郡吉際村ほか7ヶ村の民40余名が大神村字八幡下に集結して戸田村小塩八郎右衛門からの負債返済方法を協議し、不穏の形勢を示す。
sen.e: At night on March 29, 1884, more than 40 people from Yoshigiwa Village and seven other villages in that county gathered at Yawatashita, Okami Village and consulted as to how they repay debt from Hachiroemon OSHIO, and the talks ended in disorder.
sen.cmt: 「八幡下」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: At night on March 29, 1884, more than 40 people from Yoshigiwa Village and seven other villages in that county gathered at Yawatashita, Okami Village and consulted as to how they could repay debts from Hachiroemon OSHIO of Toda Village, and the talks ended with threatening movements.
sen.cmt: 文法を直し、訳漏れ部を補いました。
sen.e: At night on March 29, 1884, more than 40 people from Yoshigiwa Village and seven other villages in that county gathered at Yawatashita, Okami Village and consulted as to how they could repay debts from Hachiroemon OSHIO of Toda Village, and the talks ended in disorder.
sen.cmt: the talks ended in disorderと元の翻訳に戻しました。

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）3月、冠弥右衛門鎌倉の光明寺に徒弟入りし、全国の寺社巡礼開始。
sen.e: In March 1884, Yaemon KANMURI went to Komyo-ji Temple in Kamakura as an ascetic, and started pilgrimage to temples and shrines throughout the country.
In March 1884, Yaemon KANMURI became an ascetic of Komyo-ji Temple in Kamakura, and started pilgrimages to temples and shrines throughout the country.
In March 1884, Yaemon KANMURI became an ascetic of Komyo-ji Temple in Kamakura, and started pilgrimages to temples and shrines throughout the country.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）5月15日、淘綾郡山下村の近藤甚蔵ほか10名が同郡一色村の高利貸露木卯三郎とその雇人露木幸助を大磯宿の旅館川崎屋に襲って両人を斬殺。
sen.e: On May 15, 1884, Jinzo KONDO and other 10 people in Yamashita Village, Yurugi County attacked Usaburo TSUYUKI, a usurer in Isshiki Village in that county and his employee Kosuke TSUYUKI at an inn called Kawasakiya in Oiso-juku, and murdered them with sword.
sen.cmt: 「露木幸助」正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: On May 15, 1884, Jinzo KONDO and other 10 people in Yamashita Village, Yurugi County attacked Usaburo TSUYUKI, a usurer in Isshiki Village in that county, and his employee Kosuke TSUYUKI at an inn called Kawasakiya in Oiso-juku, and murdered them with a sword.

On May 15, 1884, Jinzo KONDO and other 10 people in Yamashita Village, Yurugi County attacked Usaburo TSUYUKI, a usurer in Isshiki Village in that county, and his employee Kosuke TSUYUKI at an inn called Kawasakiya in Oiso-juku, and murdered them with a sword.

sen.j: 首謀者5名は大磯宿で斬罪の酷刑。
sen.e: The five ringleaders received severe punishment of execution by decapitation in Oiso-juku.
The five ringleaders received capital punishment of decapitation in Oiso-juku.
The five ringleaders received capital punishment of decapitation in Oiso-juku.

sen.j: 以後、この種の事件止む。
sen.e: After that, incidents of this kind never happened.
After that, incidents of this kind ceased to happen.
After that, incidents of this kind ceased to happen.

sen.j: 1888年（明治21年）、冠弥右衛門帰郷。
sen.e: In 1888, Yaemon KANMURI returned home.
In 1888, Yaemon KANMURI returned home.
In 1888, Yaemon KANMURI returned home.

sen.j: 平塚市八幡長善寺に入り、12月15日に死去。
sen.e: He went to Chozen-ji Temple in Yawata, Hiratsuka City, and died on December 15.
He went to Chozen-ji Temple in Yawata, Hiratsuka City, and died on December 15.
He went to Chozen-ji Temple in Yawata, Hiratsuka City, and died on December 15.

sen.j: 1892年（明治25年）10月1日、泉鏡花『冠弥左衛門』京都の「日出新聞」に掲載開始。
sen.e: On October 1, 1892, Kyoka IZUMI started serializing "Kanmuri Yazaemon" in 'Hinode Newspaper' published in Kyoto.
On October 1, 1892, Kyoka IZUMI started serializing "Kanmuri Yazaemon" in 'Hinode Newspaper' published in Kyoto.
On October 1, 1892, Kyoka IZUMI started serializing "Kanmuri Yazaemon" in 'Hinode Newspaper' published in Kyoto.

sen.j: 同年11月20日まで。
sen.e: The serialization ended on November 20 in that year.
The serialization ended on November 20 in that year.
The serialization ended on November 20 in that year.

sen.j: 鏡花の文壇デビュー作。
sen.e: It was the first novel by Kyoka as a professional novelist.
It was the first novel by Kyoka as a professional novelist.
It was the first novel by Kyoka as a professional novelist.

sen.j: 「弥右衛門弥」を「弥左衛門」と変えている。
sen.e: He changed the name of 'Yaemon' into 'Yazaemon.'
He changed the name of 'Yaemon' into 'Yazaemon.'
He changed the name of 'Yaemon' into 'Yazaemon.'
